t: Psalm 51
A Prayer for Restoration
For the choir director. A psalm of David, when the prophet Nathan came to him after he had gone to Bathsheba.
Be*pn gracious to me, God, according*ln to your faithful love; according*ln to your abundant compassion, blot*ln out my rebellion.
Completely*ln wash away my guilt and*ln cleanse me from my sin.
For*ln I am conscious of my rebellion, and*ln my sin is always before me.
Against*ln you - you alone - I have sinned and*ln done this evil in your sight. So*ln you are right when you pass sentence; you*ln are blameless when you judge.
Indeed,*ln I was guilty when I was born; I*ln was sinful when my mother conceived me.
Surely*pn you desire integrity in the inner self, and*ln you teach me wisdom deep within.
Purify*ln me with hyssop, and I will be clean; wash*ln me, and I will be whiter than snow.
Let*ln me hear joy and gladness; let*ln the bones you have crushed rejoice.
Turn*ln your face away from my sins and*ln blot out all my guilt.
God,*pn create a clean heart for me and*ln renew a steadfast spirit within me.
Do*ln not banish me from your presence or*ln take your Holy Spirit from me.
Restore*ln the joy of your salvation to me, and*ln sustain me by giving me a willing spirit.
Then*ln I will teach the rebellious your ways, and*ln sinners will return to you.
Save*pn me from the guilt of bloodshed, God— God*ln of my salvation — and*ln my tongue will sing of your righteousness.
Lord,*ln open my lips, and*ln my mouth will declare your praise.
You*ln do not want a sacrifice, or I would give it; you*ln are not pleased with a burnt offering.
The*ln sacrifice pleasing to God is a broken spirit. You*ln will not despise a broken and humbled heart, God.
In*pn your good pleasure, cause Zion to prosper; build*ln the walls of Jerusalem.
Then*ln you will delight in righteous sacrifices, whole*ln burnt offerings; then*ln bulls will be offered on your altar.
